title: Lynda - Computer Literacy for Mac with Garrick Chow
description:
[size=200][b]Lynda - Computer Literacy for Mac with Garrick Chow[/b][/size] 

Subjects:  Business, Computer Skills (Mac), 
Software:  Mac OS X 

3h 28m Beginner Feb 02, 2015 | Uploaded in Feb 7, 2015 by 2boweb



Learn the ins and outs of your Mac quickly and easily with Mac expert Garrick Chow. He describes the terms and techniques in clear, easy-to-understand language and explains what goes on inside a computer, how to choose between a laptop and a desktop computer, and how to use your computer to open, create, edit, and save files. He also shows how to connect printers, scanners, external storage devices, Bluetooth-enabled speakers, and other devices to your Mac. Garrick also covers connecting to a network for Internet access, sending and receiving email, and searching for content on the Internet. He'll even take a brief tour of some common computing tasks, such as word processing, working with data in spreadsheets, photo editing, and file sharing.Ã¢â‚¬Â¨Ã¢â‚¬Â¨Note: This course was recorded on Mac OS X 10.10 Yosemite. To upgrade to Yosemite before you begin, watch "Installing and running Mac OS X 10.10 for the first time."
